result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order to Revoke Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the bail of the defendant is hereby revoked and custody is remanded to the Manitowoc County Jail.
Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 3, felony bail jumping. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 6, strike police/fire animals causing injury. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 8, fleeing an officer. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 9, possess methamphetamine. Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 4, 5, 7, 10 and 11.  Motion granted.
DNA sample is ordered.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report be completed by DOC.
PSI due on 11-15-22.
Sentencing is set for 11-22-22 at 3:00 p.m.
Court revokes bail.  State to draft the order.
Minutes.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.

1:55 PM Defendant Jessica Nicole Loney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Jessica Nicole Loney.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defense has filed another motion to modify bail. The motion was previously denied. Defense expands on the written motion. 
State is opposed to any modification of bond. The court adopts the findings of the previous motion. 
The court stands behind its decision that a modification would be inappropriate and denies the defendant's motion to modify bail. State to draft the order.
Bail/bond hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Plea date on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion 
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.

3:30 PM Defendant Jessica Nicole Loney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Lambrecht for Attorney Jill L. Vendetti appearing by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Jessica Nicole Loney. Inducement made.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch  for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for .  Scheduling conference is set for July 17, 2022.
Minutes. 

BAIL MODIFICATION:  Defense makes argument for modification of cash bail to $1,000.00.  State is opposing any modification given Defendant's prior conduct while on bond and disregard for public safety is noted.  Court finds that cash bail is appropriate and denies the motion to modify bail.  State to prepare order.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Letter from defendant to the court re: bail reduction
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - emailed 05-17-2022
Attorney Michael Turner is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Courts Office.

Defendant is currently waiting on appointment of counsel.  Defendant does wish to exercise her right to court appointment counsel if someone is not appointed through SPD.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits in which to conduct the preliminary examination.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-05-22 at 1:30 p.m.

Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of fleeing an officer, operate without owner's consent, 3 cts. felony bail jumping, first degree recklessly endangering safety, 2 cts. possess schedule 2 narcotics, possess drug paraphernalia and possess methamphetamine.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-25-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Juan P. Flores DOB: 08-31-93 and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
